ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Learned a lot about different techniques and subjects within clinical neuroscience, as well as being able to identify important points within research papers

A greater knowledge of techniques in neuroscience and clinical psychology. The greatest resource is professor Holmes himself, who spends half of the class giving advice about life and work in clinical neuroscience.
You get a really good grasp on clinical neuroscience topics. The discussions are super interesting as well.
Lot of good information about current updates in clinical neuroscience and psychiatry. Learn about the history and have good discussion about it
I became a lot better at reading scientific papers
I learned about the current state of clinical neuroscience.
I learned about the neurobiological underpinnings of psychiatric disorders and what factors affect them.
I learned a lot about current literature on clinical neuroscience
I learned how to understand complex topics in neuroscience.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Strength: Holmes is a saint. Love him so much, gives major dad vibes.
Strengths: reading response format, Prof. Holmes!!!! and the small discussion format

This course was amazing. We did not go over much in terms of content (though I expected that since this is a seminar not a lecture). Nevertheless, Prof. Holmes is super supportive and I learned a lot about life as a psychologist from him.

1. Great professor
2. Great way to get students engaged because of jumpstarts
Professor is the best. So understanding and good at explaining. Content gets a bit boring at times so finding ways to keep us engaged
I liked the jumpstarts but I feel like the class may have been a little bit better if the jumpstarts were shorter and there was more time for discussion.
I enjoyed the format and like the jumpstarts and that people could ask whatever questions came to mind.

strengths: I thought all the topics were interesting and the articles were well picked 

weakness: I felt like the class time wasn't super engaging but I guess that more so depends on the people in the class. Listening to people present on the articles was sometimes boring
I really liked the discussion-based format and the weekly reaction papers
Strengths: wide variety of topics, not a large workload, every class is very chill!! Honestly the best seminar ever

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes. Holmes is a saint. Love him so much, gives major dad vibes.
Yes! Great way to engage with primary literature, very fun class format, lowkey and always generates interesting discussions
Absolutely. Class goes by at a relaxed pace and it was a fun opportunity to learn more about clinical neuro and discuss our thoughts on it every week.
Yes absoluetly if youre interested in clinical neuroscience

Take this course. The syllabus looks intimidating at first, but Professor Holmes is an amazing teacher and the course is pretty chill. I was never stressed about the work and the papers and discussions were always great. Although it was a 1-hour-and-50-minute session once a week, the time flew by. If you have any thoughts about doing clinical psychiatry research or therapy, take the course. If you are interested in anything regarding clinical neuroscience, take the course.
YES! Great course, great discussion, prof is awesome, and good senior seminar
Yes it was very interesting
Yes!
If you are interested in clinical psychology this is a great class. I learned a lot of new things especially things related to biology
Yes! I thought it was a great opportunity to read current literature
Yes! Professor Holmes is an awesome and engaging professor who offers insight but also encourages discussion and students to answer other student questions.
YESS its boring-ish but SO easy and chill
